segments.text: How can she just stand there drying a stupid plate while the sink floods the kitchen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, ruining the cabinets and soaking the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's got one foot in the puddle and doesn't even flinch—unbelievable negligence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are climbing on that wobbly stool like it's a playground.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to grab cookies from the jar, but he'll probably fall and break his neck.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is egging him on, reaching up as if this is all a game.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Open cabinets, running faucet— this is chaos waiting to explode.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks tidy, mocking the disaster inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's turned off the water or noticed the stool tilting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: These kids are sneaking cookies right under her nose, and she doesn't care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What kind of parent lets this happen? It's infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes are stacked up, but that's the least of their problems now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to step in before everything goes to hell.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene makes my blood boil.
segments.speaker: PAR
